newsitem.title: FRANCE: No alternative in EU economic policies-de Silguy.
newsitem.headline: No alternative in EU economic policies-de Silguy.

text.p: European Union countries have no alternative but to continue economic policies meant to bolster their public finances, European Commissioner Yves-Thibault de Silguy said on Monday.

"I note that all countries, whatever their government, are carrying out the same policies and that there is no alternative today to the improvement in public finances," he told a news conference during a ministerial meeting of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development.

A first round lead on Sunday for the combined left in a French parliamentary election has sparked fears in some quarters that a Socialist-led government would be less willing to implement austerity than the ruling centre-right coalition.

The Socialist party is however committed to sound financial management and leader Lionel Jospinn said on Sunday that France needed bold economic policies which were nonetheless careful on public spending.
The second round of France's election is due on Sunday.
